definitions.text: green color or pigment; resembling the color of growing grass
a piece of open land for recreational use in an urban area
examples: they went for a walk in the park

definitions.text: United States labor leader who was president of the American Federation of Labor from 1924 to 1952 and who led the struggle with the Congress of Industrial Organizations (1873-1952)
an environmentalist who belongs to the Green Party
a river that rises in western Wyoming and flows southward through Utah to become a tributary of the Colorado River
an area of closely cropped grass surrounding the hole on a golf course
examples: the ball rolled across the green and into the bunker

definitions.text: any of various leafy plants or their leaves and stems eaten as vegetables
of the color between blue and yellow in the color spectrum; similar to the color of fresh grass
concerned with or supporting or in conformity with the political principles of the Green Party
not fully developed or mature; not ripe
naive and easily deceived or tricked
examples: at that early age she had been gullible and in love
